Column Comment.0: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.1: SUBSTANCE USE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique observation number for theuse description for a substance.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.4: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.6: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.10: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.11: COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found in the schema
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.14: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.15: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this substance is the onepreferred for use in the situation shown by the existance of foreign key relationships.Other substances may also be valid, but for special circumstances or for morerefinedreporting and business extraction.
Column Comment.16: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: SUBSTANCE ALIAS IDENTIFIER: The unique identifier for the alias that should beused in the context or situation identified by this row of data.
Column Comment.20: SUBSTANCE USE RULE DESCRIPTION: A narrataive that describes in more detaila rule controlling when or how this substance definition should be used.
Column Comment.21: SUBSTANCE USE RULE: A rule that describes in more detail a rule controlling whenor how this substance definition should be used.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.ho lastchanged the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
